website_summaries.verdict: If you’re looking for an affordable habitat for smaller critters, this one is hard to beat. Large enough to house multiple rats, hamsters, gerbils, or sugar gliders.
pros: Generous dimensions and 3 solid ledges and ramps give pets plenty of room to roam
Extra deep tray keeps bedding and litter inside the cage
Can easily be placed on top of a dresser or shelf to save space
cons: Enthusiastic chewers might gnaw their way through the plastic base
Doors are somewhat small, making spot cleaning difficult

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Rats chewed through it in less than a week leaving us to chase them around the house and reaulting in two deaths of our fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: E. K. Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cage.
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a cage of reasonable cost and a nice size that my rats could grow into bs this cage is amazing! It's huge but not an inconvient size for apartments, etc. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ebruce

customer_reviews.title: My Syrian Hamster is in love!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cage for my Teddy Bear Syrian Hamster and he is in heaven! My previous cage was 24 inches by 12 inches and he chewed the bars constantly and I read that they need a lot more room than other hamsters due to their size. This cage is a HUGE upgrade and he’s able to burrow down because the tray is deep enough! He learned the ramps after 20 minutes and loves running up and down them. He doesn’t chew the bars and he’s happy!! Bar spacing is just right for a Syrian hamster.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Ratland
customer_reviews.text: It's been difficult to find an enclosure that's both large enough to keep an entire litter male and female fancy rats in their own cages, with bar spacing that won't allow the little ones to escape. This is an affordable option that meets those requirements, providing everyone with the space they need for happy and healthy life. On the downside, the cage is slightly flimsy when disassembled, and the large size makes it awkward to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua GTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: Almost too large
customer_reviews.text: This cage is huge. I was not expecting it to be so large. I bought it for my daughter’s teddy bear hamster and I wish it were 1/3 less bigger. She has a good sized room and it looks ginormous. I could literally pull my knees into my chest and fit inside of this thing if I wanted to and I am 5’9. Hamster seems happy though, ha!
customer_reviews.author: K. N. Worrell

customer_reviews.title: Good apartment size cage .
customer_reviews.text: First let me say I use this cage for 2 rats about three months old. First thing I did after I set it up was put small animal fencing around the base. I don’t know that they would chew through but they could so why chance it. After that was installed I zip tied the cage itself together where the clips meet on the sides. I have had no issues with escape. The cage has a lot of room for the boys to play. Not terribly easy to clean but not bad. They are happy and with my little alteration I’m not worried about them escaping.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small rodents.
customer_reviews.text: I use this cage for 2 female rats. They seem to enjoy the space. I've had it for about a year and a half, and not holes yet. I highly recommend that you have some kind of chew toy in the cage though, because the base of this cage is plastic, and I believe that most rodents would be able to chew through it. Cleaning is not too bad. Separating the metal top from the plastic bottom is easy, and reassembling it is easy as well. Removing and replacing the plastic shelves is not difficult if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Samurai

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cages I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This cage looks huge compared to the pictures in the ad, I love it! Over the past 40 yrs I've bought and made cages for rats, mice, hamsters, all kinds of birds, guinea pigs & dwarf rabbits. This is my favorite cage yet. It's for a young long haired Syrian hamster and he's got room for days in it. I dont understand some of the complaints about quality. I think the quality is quite good. It's a very solid heavy feeling cage. My hamster will greatly enjoy all the extra room (as soon as he realizes the ladders lead to more levels ☺).
customer_reviews.author: Penguins Rule

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up for my daughter's 2 baby rats (2 months old). It is quite large. We set the shelves lower and I added an amazon box as a chewable hut on the bottom to make the ramps more level, and a small cat litter box with carefresh. I used fleece on the shelves. So far they seem content with it and are venturing around exploring it. I am happy with the size of the cage for the price. The only thing I don't like is the food dish that is plastic. If they decide to chew it up I am not sure what will fit in the hole. The bowl is rather large and deep.
customer_reviews.author: LNK

customer_reviews.title: Rats eat holes right through the bottom and escape...
customer_reviews.text: This started off as a great cage for my two rats. But... My cage came with a slight split in the plastic where the metal cage meets the plastic tub. This split created a gnawing point for my rats and within a couple weeks they had eaten a hole into the back of the cage. We sealed the opening with some plastic sheeting and tape. A new hole formed on the other side of the cage just days later. Our cage now looks like frankensteins monster, covered in tape and patch plastics. I can't recommend this product to rat owners because of the cheap plastic. Maybe if your rodent doesn't have teeth it will work out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s big enough for two rats to live in. I HATE that it’s hard to clean. There’s no pull out thing for the bottom so you have to take the whole top off.theres no top handle so you have to grab it by the wires and it’s heavy! Definitely a two person job. There’s also no top opening which it for sure needs. The platforms really clamp on so this is good and bad. You can’t easily take them out to wash. I just wipe them down
customer_reviews.author: aimee presnell

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Bought it for my two dwarfs. My oldest son said, for the hamsters it’s like moving in to the mansion after spending two nights in the Petco sold cage. Two days have passed since my hamsters moved in into their new cage but there is a big problem one of them cannot climb the ladder he keeps on sliding down. If anyone knows what to do in this situation please advise. Because their water and food is on second floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey and Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great rat cage
customer_reviews.text: My ratties love their new big cage! It came in a bright green color instead of the dark green. I like the bright green color a lot more so I'm happy! Lots of space for them to run around and climb. Lots of room to add accessories. Bar spacing is small so it's great for rats or if you have other small critters. I love the food bowl that sits in the plastic level because my rats would always knock over their old food bowl. Problem solved! Easy to snap together and sturdy. I researched a lot of cages but I'm glad I picked this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle Reppi

customer_reviews.title: Good, Spacious Cage!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, although one of the platforms that came with the cage doesn't snap in place like the others. The ramps are difficult to get in the right position so that they don't just float in the air, but they just need to be bent into the proper position. One of the ramps is shorter than the other two - I had to figure that out on my own, as it is not described in the instructions. Other than all this, I love the cage! Easy clean-up and my two rats love the amount space they have now!
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Great size and quality
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would be to small for my 2 rats and I would have to buy another one when they grow a bit more. No problem there as it was much bigger then I thought it would be. Perfect size for them and they have lots of room to play! No bars were bent and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my juvenile male rats and my cats!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a cage for my juvenile rats that they could grow into and this one has the perfect amount of space. The bars are close together so they can’t squeeze out of anything, they haven’t chewed at the plastic tub or pieces at all, and they can easily go up and down the ramps. There’s even enough space for their 12’ running wheel. It’s also durable and dense enough that my cats can’t knock it over, destroy the cage, or fit their paws in to swat at my rats (even though they haven’t tried. They’re more afraid of the rats than the rats are of them).
customer_reviews.author: elena

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rats!
customer_reviews.text: My friend and I got this cage for our rats and it was perfect. They weren't big chewers so they didn't chew through anything, no one escaped even when we had a litter of babies, and there was a good amount of room for playing and running around. I would say 2-3 rats would comfortably fit in this cage. We took out the shelves except for the one with the food bowl and they loved to climb the sides and relax in their hammocks. It's a good quality cage for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for babies, not adults!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my three baby boys. They were only in it for about two weeks before I put them in their big boy cage. Easy to assemble but the gap in the corners were big so I had to zip tie it. Also wasn’t the easiest thing to clean but not the worst. Due to reviews of chewing, I lined the fleece along the side and that seems do have done the trick. Recommend no more than three babies or less!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Woodworth

customer_reviews.title: Great first rat home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a travel cage because my real cage is huge but this is also a pretty big cage. I like this cage because it’s easier to take apart. It is very roomy and I think great for 2 maybe 3 rats. If you are thinking of getting a pet rat and don’t want to splurge on the Midwest critter nation this is probably the best alternative in my opinion. It’s easy to break down and deep clean compared to big all metal cages.
customer_reviews.author: Micayla K

customer_reviews.title: Rat mansion perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a rat mansion for an economical price! It's way bigger than I thought it would be. It's very roomy for my 3 juvenile male rats. I think it will be the perfect size for them when they are fully grown. The bar spacing is good, no escape attempts have been made. I have had similar smaller cages in the past and I'm confident it will clean easy. Easy set up. You do need plyers to lock the loops in the front and back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bennett

customer_reviews.title: A very happy hamster!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a house for our teddy bear hamster! It was larger then expected but so glad we got it. They need so much more space then the small little cages that people usually buy. He loves this house and has become very friendly and much happier with this much space. Just make sure you have a good spot to place it in since it does take up some room....but it’s well worth it. A little hamster hotel :)
customer_reviews.author: Shawn and Kelly W.

customer_reviews.title: One of the coolest things I've bought!
customer_reviews.text: OHHHH MAN!!!! This thing is HUGE and AWESOME!!! As a parent that got this for a well behaved child I'm going to going on and tell you all... This thing is just a perfect 10! Everything you could possibly want from an enclosure! It's well made I and easy to clean. 5 star all the way. They nailed it with this one for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Bolin

customer_reviews.title: Actual Measurements 29.5" W x29.5" H x17.5" D
customer_reviews.text: The true measurements of this product are 29.5 inch width, by 29.5 inch height, by 17.5 inch depth. I'm keeping one Dwarf Hamster in each cage I bought (two total), and they are comfortable for now. I do NOT recommend ever keeping ANY animal large than a Dwarf Hamster (2-3 inches length) in a cage this small. A Chinchilla is FAR TOO LARGE for a cage this size, and housing them in something much larger is safer and better, especially when considering a Chinchilla lives for some time around 15-20 years. Happy pet parenting, Sofía
customer_reviews.author: Sofía

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This cage is bigger and nicer than I expected it to be. I have two females rats in it and they could not be happier. I noticed some of the reviews that said their rats chewed through thr cage and that was a concern for me so I make sure they have plenty of things to chew on. I have had it a while now and have had no problems. Highly recommend. I got it at a much better price on amazon than in the store, then with prime it showed up right at my doorstep in two days...who can argue with that?
customer_reviews.author: Seeka Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my degus. After it was assembled I noticed that there are large gaps on the sides because they do not marry up properly. Not a deal breaker. I put in a 12" Kaytee "silent" spinner and the metal cage is so flimsy that the entire cage shook when a degu was on it. Finally, and the worst part, is that the plastic ramps are so slippery that my poor degu tried to climb the first one to the next level but she spun out and slid down. This is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rats
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected but that’s on me for not paying close enough attention to the description. My rat is very happy in it. He likes to scale the cage sides like spider man and sleeps beneath the bottom platform when he wants some peace. The only thing I don’t like is how deep the food bowl is. You pretty much have to fill it quiet high so your rodent doesn’t fall in it. I use a different, shallower measuring bowl that I laid on the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: TEMPORARY
customer_reviews.text: Very temporary housing. I used it for a week away. It is collapsible and easy to assemble and light weight and spacious . But where it connects at the corner edges leaves gaps. Connection for the ramp bent and would not stay snapped on so I had to tape it with strong tape. Wire bends and distorts fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Wade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cage for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is large enough to house four to five adult rats comfortably. Cleaning is easy since all you have to do is to wipe the surfaces down with cleaning wipes. The litter pan is sufficiently deep enough that litter and bedding won't be kicked out of the cage easily. My only complaint is that the way the ramps are clamped to the platforms--if you don't have the platforms inserted at correct heights, the ramps will overflexed and become unclamped.
customer_reviews.author: yaaargle

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost 3 years ago for my first rats. It wasn't a bad cage, just a real pain to clean. The only way to really clean it is to take apart the entire cage because the doors are really small. Now I'm really regretting buying this because my rats have chewed the corners and escaped. I guess I got lucky up until now and had rats that didn't care for chewing their cage. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Nitta

customer_reviews.title: We love the cage
customer_reviews.text: We love the cage! My Syrian Hamster was not able to do the ramps because they were to steep and slippery but I just lowered the shelves a little so there was not such an incline and she was able to climb them better! There is a large drop from top of cage to bottom so I installed a large hammock which is used as a net to catch her if she falls. It catches her most of the time. There are pretty large gaps in the corners which I had to add a little wire to because I thought she might be able to squeeze through but all in all, this cage is great!
customer_reviews.author: Eve A. Grueiro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for 2 male fancy rats :)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to find the perfect home for my two male fancy rats (still babies as you can see). I didn't want the cage to be too small, and I can't afford a huge one currently, so this was perfect. The spacing is perfect, I can fit the tips of my fingers in to say hi. I'm adding a couple more things to their cage, but I am very happy with this product!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Emily Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Great cage and good price too!
customer_reviews.text: This home is perfect for our two rats. After looking at many cages and reading reviews, we chose this one. There is plenty of room for two rats and they love the different levels. We did use zip ties on the corners to add some security and stability and we use clips on the doors to make sure that the rats cannot push them open. However, I think the cage would work fine without these adjustments. The bottom is deep enough to keep the carefresh bedding in place. Its still relatively easy to clean because the doors are quite large.
customer_reviews.author: kirstin

customer_reviews.title: ... of place while cleaning and one of them is super loose. Also
customer_reviews.text: Some of the shelves are vary hard to snap into and out of place while cleaning and one of them is super loose. Also, one of the ramps doesn't stay connected properly. I had to zip tie it to the shelf. Only other complaint is that mine came in an obnoxious neon green. Not bad, I guess. Just minor issues. I suppose, I'm just happy it was 2/3 the price of the one at the store.
customer_reviews.author: PirateGHz

customer_reviews.title: Very LARGE cage!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pet rats and thought they would enjoy the extra space. One does, one doesn't. The shelves can be moved to various locations so I currently have all three on the same level forming a ceiling of sorts in order to avoid stressing out my territorial fur baby. Could actually be set up as a play level and may do that eventually. Bars aren't overly strong but unless you are trying to keep a monkey in there you should be all set. Spacing is good on the bars and the tray is nice and deep so it keeps most of the shavings where they belong.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this cage really can’t be beat. It’s large enough for 3-4 rats, with plenty of room for them to climb and play. Decent quality, especially with the change to how the cage sits in the base. I had the previous version of this cage when it was made by SuperPet, and it feels much more secure now that it has prongs keeping the base on. My only complaint is the cage is no longer the forest green in the product image. The base and shelves are lime green. I’m a little annoyed at amazon for not having updated the picture, and I was very surprised when I received the cage.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet rats!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for 2-3 rats. The shelves and ramps are plastic, so very easy to wipe down weekly or remove for deep cleaning montlhly. Twice quarterly I can easily remove the top from bottom for a full clean. Litter box fits in and out easily. Three levels, plenty of room for climbing and hanging hammocks and toys. **** no more than three comfortably****
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: It is a good cage, and it is nice and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 male rats. They have separate cages due to dominance problems, but I will be using this one to let them play together for a few hours a night. It is a good cage, and it is nice and roomy. I'm still deciding how to arrange everything in the cage. Putting it together was frustrating. I wish the levels had a better method of placement. The way they lock in isn't the best. It's hard to angle your arm in there to place them easily. I plan on lining the levels with fleece/microfiber towels and using bedding in the bottom of the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Lyn

customer_reviews.title: The platforms are fairly easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's roomy. The bars are spaced well. The platforms are fairly easy to clean. The rats haven't chewed much of it at all. The doors are easy to open and close. Cons: The platforms can be tough to install. The clips on the ramps are very flimsy. You have to dismantle it almost entirely to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: akleyn

customer_reviews.title: Great cage for our rats
customer_reviews.text: Great cage for our first rats. Love the different levels and can interchange things. It would be nice to have a door at the top though so that we could reach in and clean out the items we have hanging on the top. Other than that very happy with this cage. Wire spacing great for 2 month olds.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Silva

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long term housing of ferrets, but perfect for chinchillas or rats!
customer_reviews.text: I am sure that had the entire product arrived to me that it would have been a good cage. Very large, great for a couple of chinchillas or rats. I don't think it's spacious enough for long term housing of ferrets however. Mine was missing the shelves when it arrived, and ramps as well. I think it was a manufacture error. Amazon return policy was wonderful and I was able to get a refund. I decided not to order a replacement online.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Works for two to three rats
customer_reviews.text: Note: If your rat is eating through the bottom or the shelves, then perhaps it does not have enough to play with, chew on, or do in their cage. Of course some rats just do that regardless. My rats haven't chewed through it in the last three or four months we've had it. They seem pretty content. I prefer plastic since hard wire bottoms and levels will cause a blistering issue called "bumble foot". Which can be helped in those types of cages, but if you can, go for the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Rianne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rats except...
customer_reviews.text: I love this cage. It's perfect for my two rats, gives them plenty of space to climb around, and is excellent value for money. The one small problem I have with it is that the doors are too small. A rat-sized exercise wheel does not fit through the door and a rat-sized igloo house just barely does. That means I just have to clean around the wheel, or take the cage apart if I want to remove the wheel. Rats have big toys -- give us big doors! Other than that, it's just the cage I needed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: They are very happy with the added space and love running up and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cage for my two fancy rats. They are very happy with the added space and love running up and down the ramps, which are not made of wire so you run no risk of them injuring their feet. My only complaint about this cage is that it is a bit difficult to clean the different levels, as they are hard to get to and taking them in and out weekly when cleaning is a pain because it's a bit tricky to set them back up properly again. But overall, my ratties and I are very happy.
customer_reviews.author: AlliG

customer_reviews.title: Chewed through within a day.
customer_reviews.text: I had this cage now for about 16 hours and it's been chewed through. My 3 rats were able to get out and run free in my office without me knowing for a few hours causing a good deal of damage. The reviews looked so great and a friend told me to get this for them. Absolute waste of money! Stay away if you have gnawing animals like rats.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Roomy for the critters
customer_reviews.text: Great size and room to play for the critters, but a pain for the human who might be trying to reach an uncooperative occupant. I am not pleased with what is required to take it apart to clean it. For the price, it IS a nice cage for the animals, though. Just be prepared to have to unclip and lift off the entire top to get at the base. Again - NOT a bad product and my two rats really love it with all the ramps and levels. I am not a big fan of it but only because of the access and cleaning. Still a reasonably priced large space for your pets.
customer_reviews.author: PatmAC

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our new pet rats. We have 2 and its perfect. I was worried because of some reviews talking about chewing holes. We are good so far. We love this cage. They have plenty of room to move around. We did use wire ties to close up the corners just to make sure.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: I have had this cage for less than 2 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cage for less than 2 months, and my rats have chewed a rat-sized hole in the corner of the plastic base and escaped!!! I now have to catch them, which has given me the added expense of a live rat trap. And then when I successfully trap them, I have NO clue where I can safely place them.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Rat Owners Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR RATS!! Rats were able to chew through the plastic bottom and escape. Waste of money there. Also, the cage doors are too small and not positioned well, making it difficult to clean the shelves toward the back if you have normal human-length arms with bones in them (I'm assuming most readers will fit this description). So, the cage pretty much always smelled like pee. Find an all metal cage for your rats.
customer_reviews.author: UKjane

customer_reviews.title: pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: This cage was super easy to put together. I guess the thing that's most frustrating is the plastic "stair" pieces (gray) are very very very flimsy. My rat has nearly broken them with his weight, and he is under average size for his age. Other than that, the cage is very easy to take apart and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kassira

customer_reviews.title: Hamster
customer_reviews.text: My hamster Mac and Cheese had been living in a cramped cage for the first couple months I had him. He began escaping because it was too small. I knew I needed an upgraded home for him but all the "hamster" cages were still much too small. I was weary of this cage because of the price but his happiness and wellbeing were worth it to me. It's been a wonderful cage so far, he no longer escapes and he runs up and down his ramps all night. He's a happy guy and if you are looking for a cage for your hammy I recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Really Love this cage
customer_reviews.text: This cage has been really sturdy against my 3 female rats, they're very destructive but I find since they have enough toys they haven't ever tried to chew on the bottom of the cage. This cage has plenty of room for them as young females, if they stay small females I believe it'll house them just fine however if they become on the larger side it'll probably be better to upgrade to a bigger cage. I do recommend zip tying the sides where the cage folds together because the gap can be big enough for them to squeeze through. I think this is a very nice compact cage.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to house a syrian hamster! We divided the cage in 2 with the platforms all aligned to create 2 individual syrian hamster cages!
customer_reviews.author: Damon C.M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The price is really really good compared to other pricing for smaller cages
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of shopping around before purchasing this cage. The price is really really good compared to other pricing for smaller cages. My two rats love the multiple floors, running up and down the levels, and climbing up the sides. The cages is very easy to put together and, even better, easy to clean! I haven't had any issues with my rats chewing the cage wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cage For Rats
customer_reviews.text: Love this cage! It is perfect for two adult rats to live comfortably and mine navigate the ramps with ease. They took to it immediately and their xl wheel fits in the bottom just fine. I would only say I am worried as there is so much plastic but they haven't chewed on anything so far. I just put lots of chew toys and healthy rat treats in there as well.
customer_reviews.author: Zoology Lover

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The shipping and product packaging were undamaged, but the cage was severely bent and out of place where a corner connected. My pet would have walked right out no problem. It also looked like a connection hook was missing. Had to return, but that was good no questions asked process.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted Ninja Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Rats done chewed a hole in the base and were dropping turds on the carpet with impunity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sweet niece (my sister couldn't be happier) it is a great size for pet rats. However, they will possibly chew out the base and leave the inside for the outside. If that happens you will need to get creative at the hardware store to prevent them escaping. Unfortunately, the manufacturer doesn't make a replacement metal base. Other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Large yet compact. Great for starter cage.
customer_reviews.text: Great for small homes with its compact size yet large enough for lots of space for small animals. Assembly was easy. Directions aren’t clear or correct as to which bars to place the levels on, using the picture on the box to determine where the levels go was much easier. Ramps easily click onto levels. Bar spacing is small, which I great for the safety of my rats with cats in the house. Cage locks into bottom tray and is easy to remove for cleaning but sturdy. Does come with food dish that fits inside one of the levels. Love this cage so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mordred

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for older ferret!
customer_reviews.text: Our ferret was getting up in age and doesn't climb as much, so this cage is the perfect size for him. I love the size of it for him and love the built in water dish (he can't dump over his water!). The only issue I have with this cage are the ladders. They are difficult to get on and to stay on properly. While not a major problem, I wish there was a side door to help get to the shelves for cleaning purposes. But again, for what I needed for my older ferret, this cage is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this cage for my 3 boys. I hate all the shelfs in at once but it has plenty of room for tons of hammocks. I highly suggest if you get this cage get lots of chew toys so they don't focus on the bottom pan. The bottom is deep that I usually fill it up since my boys love to burrow.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good size for a hamster and is it very big.
customer_reviews.text: My hamster loves this cage. She loves to run around. This cage is very large and perfect for her. She used to be in a starter cage for a while and it was very small. But now she lives in the “penthouse”! 😂 The only thing bad about the cage is that when it ships, some of the metal bends, but you could bend it back. Overall, this cage is a bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but not functional
customer_reviews.text: This product would be perfect if it had a sliding tray at the bottom. It is very hard to remove all the dirt by pulling it out through a little window. A tray would have made a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Lina F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This cage is nice-- super spacious and encourages climbing and romping. My two girls (ratties) love it! However, if you're not going to dismantle it every time to clean it, you'll have a difficult time. Just spot cleaning every day is a huge pain in the butt! My girls like to poop in the "gutter" spaces, which are hard to clean. The shelves and ramps don't snap in/snap out easily, I had to use a wrench the last time I needed to take a ramp off. Wires were bent when I received my cage. I wouldn't recommend this to someone that didn't have ample time available to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Hemly

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a good cage. Very roomy
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good cage. Very roomy, easy to put together and not to much hassle to clean. I took out the rams so my two rats jump/climb around. I have two large houses and a giant wheel which all fit without bribing overcrowded. The reason I give it four stars is because it's a bit flimsy. It's not the sturdiest of cages and the bars can bend much easier than any other cage I've owned. For the price this is a great cage and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room and pretty sturdy, but the solid platforms get dirty fast. I have to clean my two male rats almost daily because of all the "mess" that ends up on the solid platforms. The platforms slide around freely too, which is annoying. I also wish the pan were a little deeper. The boys can easily flick their bedding out while they're playing. The popular little "igloo" shaped huts don't fit well under the bottom platform if there is bedding in the pan (and why wouldn't there be?). It interferes with the food dish sitting properly.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Poorly thought out for little critters
customer_reviews.text: Spacious, but the critters would end up climbing up high or falling from the shelving, or on the shelving from hanging from the top, and risked injury. I had to shorten the height of the cage and remove all levels to make is safe and clean. They'd leave excrement on the levels and then end up kicking it out of the cage everywhere - nasty. So, good build quality, nice idea, but not realistic or reasonably manageable as it was.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: False advertising - far from “chewproof”
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely not worth the money. Manufacturer is misleading with the statement “without any leeway for escapees thanks to the chew-proof latches. ” the latches might be chew-proof but as this picture shows, the rest of the cage isn’t. I would expect something a little more durable for a hundred dollars than this garbage. If they are going to use the term “chew-proof” they should offer a refund when then shoddy product fails miserably.
customer_reviews.author: David Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It's a little tricky to put together but pretty easy still
customer_reviews.text: It's a little tricky to put together but pretty easy still. This is a great deal for the price. I have two rats and finally got them something more spacious and they're loving it already. Kaytee products are usually wonderful, so I'm not surprised. My only regret is not buying it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: ella bryn

customer_reviews.title: This cage is perfect for our three rats
customer_reviews.text: This cage is perfect for our three rats, there is enough space for all three and they seem to be able to move around enough while they are in there. I love the cup holding level! It's so convenient and makes it way easier to keep a full water bowl in their cage. I knocked off a star because of how the cage part attached to the plastic base, if you don't pick up this giant cage by the base the base will often just fall off, making it hard to transport/clean alone. But overall it's exactly what I want and expected and I'm really glad with the price, condition, and size!
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: great starter home
customer_reviews.text: this is great! its a fabulous starter home for your chin! i wouldnt recommend keeping him in this permanently as a chin needs space 2 to 3 times bigger than this. however as i said great starter home and even i who am terrible at putting things together was able to get this together moderately quick. quality is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Mae

customer_reviews.title: Seems great, great assembly
customer_reviews.text: Seems great, great assembly, large, beatiful lime green color, cool bowl and ladders, rats love it, but sadly it is not rat proof. Two weeks into having it they are slowly chipping away at the plastic bottom of the cage and have finally created a hole I'm which they can escape. This is not a rat proof cage.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great cage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Syrian. Very spacious, he climbs the ramps easily, I love it. This is the third cage I tried for him and it’s great. He is a climber so the wire walls allow him to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great cage!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful cage for a great price. I have 3 medium size female rats in it and they have lots of room to run around and play. Pretty simply to put together. I used some zip ties where the corners meet just to secure it a little extra. Overall, I’m extremely happy with this cage
customer_reviews.author: JennaLauren

customer_reviews.title: 2 rats love it
customer_reviews.text: Big upgrade from old cage. Haven't had any issues with chewing but then again, my rats didn't chew through their old cage. Only assembly is unfolding the cage and putting it through holes in the base. Only clean-up needed was rinsing, everything came right off.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Not chew proof
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good cage for my chinchilla. It has lots of room for her to run around. The only problem I have is that she has eaten through the ladders and the top shelve within 2 months. I now have to purchase an all metal cage. Would probably work if you didn’t have a chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Slithersoul666

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cage for a rat
customer_reviews.text: This cage is awesome and it is much bigger than I expected! We found someone's pet rat and can't find the owner. Ha Ha, now her name is Francine. The bottom pa is very deep, the cage is well put together and strong and she has plenty of room to run around. Took a few days to learn the ladders but now she runs around and uses each level for something different, sleeping, burrowing and hiding stuff. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mc

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cage and so do my three dwarf rats! It was pretty simple to assemble and it’s a nice size for a pair of rats or a trio of dwarf rats! The levels are really sturdy and there’s room to add hammocks and toys in for them to play with! Sometimes cleaning and be a little bit of a challenge since the levels have little ridges on them, but otherwise it’s a pretty great cage!
customer_reviews.author: Helen C.

customer_reviews.title: Best cage on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I dont think you'll find a better cage in this price range, i used it for my two male rats and it was the perfect amont of space for them. The shelves can be pushed down to snap them to the cage bars so they down shift around unless u want them to, though when u assemble it i would suggest pinching the hooks that hold to walls together a little tighter with some pliers, but overall 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine McShea

customer_reviews.title: Rats destroyed the base.
customer_reviews.text: If you have rats that love to chew, this isn't the cage for them, as i had kept 2 juvenile females in this cage, only to find a large 4" wide hole in the corner and my girls hidden under my curio cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for mice without adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: Mice will escape with Out zip ties on the corners. Fortunately I was able to recatch mine safely. This is huge. Several animals could live in it.
customer_reviews.author: Cari Mills

customer_reviews.title: it works but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: The product holds up well but the reviews don't lie, the metal bars will be bent or missing welds, mine was still usable and in good condition even but I would recommend getting zip ties to go along with this purchase. I currently have three rats in it and they haven't chewed the plastic on the cage bottom which is a plus. I will say it is easier to clean and I like how easy it is to remove the top part. I would recommend this product for the casual owner .
customer_reviews.author: athena

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to set up correctly
customer_reviews.text: This cage is tricky to set up. No matter how I arranged the three shelves, the ramp leading up to the first shelf was too short and hovered above the ground. I removed the ramp because I didn't feel safe letting my rats use it -- however, they have no trouble getting around the cage. Apart from that, it's an excellent cage for my two pet rats. Tons of space to hang hammocks and space pods!
customer_reviews.author: Tianna

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and Beware of chewable spots !
customer_reviews.text: It’s very spacious, it was very easy to assemble, bars are sturdy and no large gaps.I had to update my review since my Rat decided to chew a golf ball size hole on the corner ! I also read other reviews that pets have chewed the clamps on the ramps ...I only had the cage for two weeks my money didn’t get to go far !
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice "big" starter home
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble if you can count to ten! LOL. The cage part is awkward at first, but then "clips right together". You will want some additional wire (steel) ties or wire to place between the clips...for those pets that are very smart and can read the assembly directions...Have a small pair of pliers available to tighten the pre-made clips, saves your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Toft

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, thats for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I had to ziptie every single corner about 3 times, my product came broken and I had to fix it, cheaply made and I wasn't impressed....but the size is great for price. You will need zip ties for smaller rats, the bars were super unevenly spaced.
customer_reviews.author: Brerightback

customer_reviews.title: This thing is HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cage. Plenty of space for my rat Joey to climb and run around. I knew this cage was going to be big when I got it, but this was WAY bigger than I expected! Also, just a note, the one I got came in a brighter shade of green than the picture on here (which is identical to the picture on the box it came in). I'm not complaining since I like the brighter color anyway, but if you're dead-set on getting the darker green, you might find yourself a little disappointed. I absolutely love this cage though. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Good Size for my Three Girls
customer_reviews.text: My rats love this habitat! I have 3 girls and this is the perfect size for them! I wouldn't recommend housing more than 2 males or 3 females in this habitat, though, due to space. I love the two heights of doors, too!
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Decent cage.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cage. I love everything about it except the doors. It is two difficult to clean and reach in to get things out for cleaning or even reaching the rats if they are in a corner of the cage because the doors are too small. Came quickly and is exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: patsygb

customer_reviews.title: Rat approved
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two rats bout two months ago, had them in a glas aquarium. Knew I needed something bigger for growing into. Came a couple days early, put it all together all and I can just tell that they enjoy the freedom and space the cage offers I and my rats love it. The only thing that was different was the color. It's more of a neon gree than a hunter green, which I like even more.
customer_reviews.author: shyan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Its great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its great for the price, my two 6 week old rats are having a great time with all the space. Like others I used zip ties to secure the corners and binder clips on the doors which I would advice to anyone. I also spent a good fifteen minutes reshaping the bars and so far so good! It did come without one of the ramps but my rats are little climbers and they seem to like the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Nevil

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this for a rat!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cage for my granddaughter for Christmas. I wish I would have investigated a bit future. Once her rat decided she wanted to spend more time outside, it didn't take long to chew through it. This is extremely disappointing! Not only does she have a worthless gift but we need to find a new home for her rat. Wish I could give it 0 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: mcmeekcr

customer_reviews.title: An EXCELLENT Choice!
customer_reviews.text: A decent sized Rattie cage! I'm fact I've bought a lovely Double Critter Nation but it is difficult for me to clean so I'm going to instead purchase more of these cages to replace my DCN! In the Rattie Community you could NOT get a better compliment than that... I am however taking a single point off for the base not being able to secure to the cage sides. That is Important to me (and others it seems) and this cage simply sits on it's base.
customer_reviews.author: Land-Of-The-MIDNIGHT-Sun

customer_reviews.title: The cage is such great quality. The wires are very strong and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The cage is such great quality. The wires are very strong and the plastic is durable. It is also so much bigger than I had imagined in the picture. Like the cage is huge. I'm just worried that my rats won't be able to climb up the huge plastic ladders, but other than that, it has a great price for such a big cage!! Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kangtsui

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: There are so many cheap, garbage options for hamster cages, thank god I found this. It’s huge and my hamster loves it. It’s big enough to play around in and put plenty of toys in.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth385

customer_reviews.title: Totally pimp rat condo
customer_reviews.text: I got this cage for my two adult rats and they seem to think it's pretty awesome. There'st tons of room for them to explore and play, and it can be pimped out in myriad ways. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because the wire sides are a little wonky. They can pop open rather easily when you take it apart to clean it, and the clips on the side (at least on mine) don't really clip on that well. Also, it is sort of a b**** to clean, especially since the top doesn't open. Be prepared to either pop the shelves out or reach in at weird angles to clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great cage
customer_reviews.text: This cage was super easy to set up. I didn’t have any issues when putting it together. Shipping did take a while to actually get shipped but once it did the package was deliver fairly quickly. I have three female rats that I bought this cage for and they love it. They were in a small cage before and I needed to get them a bigger cage and this was perfect without being too large.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Go

customer_reviews.title: My rats love this cage!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cage for two rats. They love it. Is very easy to assemble, it's easy to clean and the construction is fabulous. Far superior to their old cage. They are not chewing the edges!!
customer_reviews.author: Dalene

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this cage
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cage! It is a lot bigger than I expected and there is plenty of room for the two male rats that live in it. The shelves and ramps are durable, easy to wipe down, and easy to move around. The bottom has plenty of room for a little house, a litter pan, some toys, and then some. Not only do I love the cage, but I love the company. When it was shipped to me, one of the shelves and ramps was damaged. I contacted them and they placed a replacement order promptly and with no questions asked. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Z

customer_reviews.title: Kay tee My First Home Habitat
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this as a bird cage and it is great. Good size, great door openings and easy to clean. I honestly think this is way to small for a chinchilla. They need much more space than this. But it would be great for a pet rat or hamster. And as I say it works great as a bird cage.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Fisher

customer_reviews.title: So far this is where i am at
customer_reviews.text: As of this moment I have yet to open the Amazon box, but I am going to document my experience with this cage so I can let anyone else looking for an affordable cage that will actually hold up for longer than a year, can see first hand if this cage will work. I am doing this because I have read so many consumer reviews over the past few days I think my head will explode. I hope this review can help someone who was in the same position I was!
customer_reviews.author: Katie francisco

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for when my daughter comes to visit and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for when my daughter comes to visit and brings her rats. They seem to love the different levels and feel quite at home. Also, is quite easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kress

product_meta.title: Kaytee My First Home 30 X 18 Multilevel Exotics
product_meta.description: Kaytee My First Home Multi-Level Exotics Cage's wire locks directly into the base for added security and durability. The latches are made out of chew proof wire and connect directly to the cage wire. Multiple levels provide extra space for pets to climb and play.
feature_bullets: Ideal habitat for chinchillas, rats and exotic pets
Multiple levels to climb and play
Chew proof locks and wires for added safety

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
